parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From ana and phero; to take up.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Body, flesh; the body of the Church. From sozo; the body, used in a very wide application, literally or figuratively.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From another form of the base of xestes; timber; by implication, a stick, club or tree or other wooden article or substance.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To be away, be removed from, depart life, die. Past participle of a compound of apo and ginomai; absent, i.e. Deceased.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: To live, be alive. A primary verb; to live.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Genitive Masculine Singular

str2: A bruise, stripe, left on the body by scourging. From molos and probably ops; a mole or blow-mark.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To heal, generally of the physical, sometimes of spiritual, disease. Middle voice of apparently a primary verb; to cure.
